Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xamarin.Android x86 unknown crash when running under Azure macOS Hosted Agent" (#3385) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @jeromelaban on Tue, 23 Jul 2019 16:53:17 GMT_

### Steps to Reproduce

1. On a macOS Hosted Agent, run [this file](https://github.com/unoplatform/uno/blob/90d55a7f3c555c07182fdf450c2850961889597c/build/android-uitest-run.sh) at this commit.
2. The application will run tests based on Xamarin.UITest in a simulator

I have not been able to repro in another setup, could be timing related.

### Expected Behavior
The Xamarin.UITests end successfully.

### Actual Behavior
The app crashes with the following logs:

```

07-23 13:35:39.716  5588  5588 E mono-rt : 13bc0000-2ac00000 rw-p 00fc0000 00:05 14281                              /dev/ashmem/dalvik-main space (region space) (deleted)
07-23 13:35:39.716  5588  5588 E mono-rt : 57f4d000-57f52000 r-xp 00000000 fc:00 2464                               /system/bin/app_process32

07-23 13:35:39.716  5588  5588 E mono-rt : 70ad7000-70ada000 r--p 00031000 fc:01 14675                              /data/dalvik-cache/x86/system@framework@boot-conscrypt.art
```

- Also tested with `Xamarin.Android.Sdk-OSS-9.4.0.59_d16-2_6d9b105.pkg` from [Jenkins](https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android-d16-2/).

### Log File
[android-device-log (14).txt](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3423195/android-device-log.14.txt)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] iOS CollectionView not updating VisualState on pre-selected items when loaded" (#6967) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

I am using a CollectionView to handle multiple selection on a bound ItemsSource. The bindings work fine for both ItemsSource and SelectedItems. I am using a templated view for the cells in the CollectionView, and have set up VisualState Setters for both the Selected and Normal states in the CommonStates VisualStateGroup.

On Android, when the CollectionView loads, the VisualStates are applied correctly, and pre-selected items in the bound SelectedItems property are displaying as expected.

On iOS, when the CollectionView loads, the VisualStates are not applied correctly. When the first item in ItemsSource is selected, the VisualState is applied. Any other selected items do not get the Visual State style, but get the default selected style. When the first item in ItemsSource is not selected, all selected items get the default selected styling, and none get the VisualState style.

### Expected Behavior

Selected VisualState should behave the same on both platforms, with defined styles applied to selected cells when the CollectionView loads.

### Actual Behavior

Selected VisualState is not applied at load time to all selected items in the bound collection. This VisualState is not applied until the user interacts with the CollectionView by selecting another item, or scrolling the view.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.1.0.618606
- Last known good version: NA
- IDE: VS 2017 Enterprise
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Views loaded inside the DataTemplate is not clipped when fast scrolling happens only on 3.3.0 version" (#4712) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

We would like to bring to your notice a bug that we encountered recently, **Views loaded inside the DataTemplate is not clipped when fast scrolling happens, Issue came only on 3.3.0 version**, We have SfDataGrid Custom Control which is derived from Grid, And we have DataTemplate to load the customViews, Load the label inside the DataTemplate, In this case scroll the SfDataGrid fastly, Inside of the DataTemplate loaded CustomViews are not clipped outside of the Grid, Issue was Xamarin forms Android.
**In Xamarin forms version 3.2.0.871581, this case was working fine views are clipped perfectly while scrolling, But after updating the Xamarin forms version to 3.3.0.967583 Views are not clipped properly which is loaded inside the DataTemplate.**

We have attached the video for issue replicated xamarin forms version, and working xamarin forms version.

We are pretty sure this issue was only on xamarin froms version 3.3.0.967583, So Provide the solution from your side, Also let us know at which upcoming version can we expect this bug will get fixed ? 

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Run the attached sample (Clean the sample and deploy It, If Syncfusion.Xamarin.SfDataGrid packages are not restored, you can download the package from nuget.org)
2.  Scroll the Grid 
3.  You can able to see Inbetween Button and SfDataGrid space, There was a blue color view(Label View which is loaded inside the DataTemplate) comes and hides continuously while scrolling(blinking occurs)

### Expected Behavior
Views loaded inside the DataTemplate should clipped perfectly out of the Grid, when scrolling happens like previous xamarin forms versions 3.2.0.871581. 

### Actual Behavior
Views loaded inside the  DateTemplate is not clipped outside properly while scrolling in xamarin forms version  3.3.0.967583  

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  3.3.0.967583
- Last known good version: 3.2.0.871581
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: All version of Android version
- Nuget Packages: 3.3.0.967583
- Affected Devices: All Android devices 

### VideoLink
Issue Video link:
http://www.syncfusion.com/downloads/support/directtrac/general/ze/Issue-1284649642
Without Issue Video link :
http://www.syncfusion.com/downloads/support/directtrac/general/ze/Withoutissue1203811962

### Reproduction Link
http://www.syncfusion.com/downloads/support/directtrac/general/ze/DataGrid3_1-124841335

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "UIButton.SetAttributedTitle should allow me to pass in null for the title parameter" (#6649) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

Run the following code against a UIButton
```
containedButton .SetAttributedTitle(null, UIControlState.Normal);
```

And you will get an ArgumentNullException

If you run the same code on native iOS
```
[containedButton setAttributedTitle:nil forState:UIControlStateNormal];
```

The code runs fine.

### Expected Behavior

I should be allowed to pass null into UIButton.SetAttributedTitle

### Actual Behavior

I'm not allowed to pass null into UIButton.SetAttributedTitle

### Environment



Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xamarin does not install an older version to support older systems" (#6648) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use a Mac (Macbook 7,1) which is only limited to MacOS 10.13.6 through normal means (10.14 is possible through modified installations, but I do not feel safe yet doing so)
2. Install Visual Studio normally through the website process
3. Install XCode 10.1 through https://developer.apple.com/download/ as that is the last version to support 10.13 (XCode 10.2, is a macOS 10.14 and higher requirement) 

### Expected Behavior
Xamarin.Mac should still operate on XCode 10.1, and Visual Studio/Xamarin does not attempt to install an older version that does support a copy of XCode that is installed on the machine
### Actual Behavior
Simply recieved error:
"/Users/mac/Documents/Visual Studio/LearningVisualStudioMac/LearningVisualStudioMac/MMP: Warning MM0079: The recommended Xcode version for Xamarin.Mac 5.10.0 is Xcode 10.2 or later. The current Xcode version (found in /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer) is 10.1. (MM0079)"

### Environment
Visual Studio for Mac on Macbook 7,1 running macOS 10.13.6

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Testflight startup crash for app build with Xamarin.iOS greater than 12.2.1.11" (#6177) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use a Xamarin.iOS version greater than 12.2.1.11 (e.g. 12.8.0.2)
2. Archive any iOS application in Release mode and submit it to Testflight
3. Install and open the application 
4. The application shouldn't crash

### Expected Behavior


### Actual Behavior

The application crashes. If you use the Device Log (from Xcode) you'll see:

```
Attempt to add an app with insufficient id, info {
    BKSApplicationStateAppIsFrontmost = 1;
    BKSApplicationStateExtensionKey = 0;
    SBApplicationStateDisplayIDKey = "com.example.app";
    SBApplicationStateKey = 8;
    SBApplicationStateProcessIDKey = 20699;
    SBMostElevatedStateForProcessID = 8;
} 
```
Interestingly enough there is no crashed reported on the device.

Interestingly enough, if I distribute the same app (100% same build settings) using an Ad-Hoc provisioning profile the issue doesn't reproduce.

I've tried recreating the production certificate and provisioning profile, and the issue still reproduces.


### Environment

It works for instance with (extracted from a script used on Azure Pipelines to control the SDK versions):

XCODE_PATH="/Applications/Xcode_10.1.app"
MONO_VERSION="5.16.1"
XAMARIN_IOS_VERSION="12.2.1.11"

it doesn't work however with 

XCODE_PATH="/Applications/Xcode_10.2.app"
MONO_VERSION="5.16.1"
XAMARIN_IOS_VERSION="12.2.1.16"

or

XCODE_PATH="/Applications/Xcode_10.2.app"
MONO_VERSION="5.16.1"
XAMARIN_IOS_VERSION="12.8.0.2"

or

XCODE_PATH="/Applications/Xcode_10.2.1.app"
MONO_VERSION="5.16.1"
XAMARIN_IOS_VERSION="12.8.0.2"

Can't tell if it's a a Xamarin.iOS or an Xcode issue, or an interoperability issue.

Also I've found this recent Xamarin Forums post mentioning the same issue:

https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/155777/ios-app-runs-perfectly-on-device-but-not-in-testflight?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MT2001: Could not link assemblies. Reason: Value cannot be null." (#6214) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi!

I'm unable to build a Xamarin.iOS app on an Azure DevOps hosted agent because of a linking error. Firstly, I thought that [an update of VS for Mac ](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-image-generation/issues/947) could help to resolve the issue, but it didn't.
Furthermore, everything works fine in mine and my teammate's local environment.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Try to build a Xamarin.iOS project with "Link framework SDKs only" option and PSPDFKit assemblies referenced. Those assemblies can be got from https://github.com/PSPDFKit/Xamarin-iOS and https://pspdfkit.com/try/. I can't add them to the issue, so they have to be built separately.

### Expected Behavior
The build is successful.

### Actual Behavior
The build fails with "error MT2001: Could not link assemblies."

### Environment

[hosted agent software.txt](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/files/3261733/hosted.agent.software.txt)


### Build Logs

```c
_CompileToNative:
  /Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.iOS.framework/Versions/Current/bin/mtouch -v -v -v -v @/Users/vsts/[...]/obj/iPhone/Ad-Hoc/response-file.rsp
MTOUCH : error MT2001: Could not link assemblies. [/Users/vsts/[...]/[Project].csproj]
    Type: `PSPDFKit.UI.PSPDFAnnotationStateManager`
    Assembly: `PSPDFKit.iOS.UI, Version=8.3.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null`
  Reason: Value cannot be null.
  Parameter name: key
  --- inner exception
  System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null.
  Parameter name: key
    at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[TKey,TValue].FindEntry (TKey key) [0x00008] in <f3f2aa82c3a04d48845485ce37124803>:0
    at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[TKey,TValue].TryGetValue (TKey key, TValue& value) [0x00000] in <f3f2aa82c3a04d48845485ce37124803>:0
    at Xamarin.Tuner.DerivedLinkContext.GetCustomAttributes (Mono.Cecil.ICustomAttributeProvider provider, System.String storage_name) [0x00017] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/common/DerivedLinkContext.cs:89
    at Xamarin.Tuner.DerivedLinkContext.GetCustomAttributes (Mono.Cecil.ICustomAttributeProvider provider, System.String namespace, System.String name) [0x00001] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/common/DerivedLinkContext.cs:120
    at Xamarin.Linker.MobileExtensions.HasCustomAttribute (Mono.Cecil.ICustomAttributeProvider provider, Xamarin.Tuner.DerivedLinkContext context, System.String namespace, System.String name) [0x00017] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/linker/MobileExtensions.cs:32
    at Xamarin.Linker.Steps.CoreMarkStep.MarkInterfaceImplementation (Mono.Cecil.TypeDefinition type, Mono.Cecil.InterfaceImplementation iface) [0x0001a] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/linker/CoreMarkStep.cs:294
    at Mono.Linker.Steps.MarkStep.MarkType (Mono.Cecil.TypeReference reference) [0x0015f] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/external/mono/external/linker/linker/Linker.Steps/MarkStep.cs:728
    at Xamarin.Linker.Steps.MobileMarkStep.MarkType (Mono.Cecil.TypeReference reference) [0x00001] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/linker/MobileMarkStep.cs:71
    at Xamarin.Linker.Steps.CoreMarkStep.MarkType (Mono.Cecil.TypeReference reference) [0x00090] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/linker/CoreMarkStep.cs:172
    at MonoTouch.Tuner.MonoTouchMarkStep.MarkType (Mono.Cecil.TypeReference reference) [0x00001] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/linker/MonoTouch.Tuner/MonoTouchMarkStep.cs:84
    at Mono.Linker.Steps.MarkStep.InitializeType (Mono.Cecil.TypeDefinition type) [0x0005b] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/external/mono/external/linker/linker/Linker.Steps/MarkStep.cs:109

    at Xamarin.Linker.Steps.MobileMarkStep.Process (Mono.Linker.LinkContext context) [0x00001] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/linker/MobileMarkStep.cs:33

    at Xamarin.Bundler.Target.ManagedLink () [0x00720] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/mtouch/Target.cs:664
    at Xamarin.Bundler.Target.ProcessAssemblies () [0x000c2] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/mtouch/Target.cs:868
    at Xamarin.Bundler.Application.ProcessAssemblies () [0x0002f] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/mtouch/Application.cs:1416
```

Cannot provide a sample project since the build is successful in my local environment.
